title: Sierra County MEHKO
description: Home-based restaurant permit for up to 30 meals/day or 90 meals/week, max $100,000 annual sales. No signage; food must be prepared, cooked, and served/delivered the same day.

steps.title: Plan Your MEHKO
steps.content:
**What to do:** Review Sierra County’s MEHKO rules and confirm you qualify.

**Why it matters:** You must operate within MEHKO rules to be approved and stay compliant.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Residence in Sierra County
- ☐ Menu and production plan (≤30/day, ≤90/week)
- ☐ Kitchen setup meeting food safety practices

**Where/how:** Check Sierra County Environmental Health or the Board resolution (2021-154 & 2024 approval).

**Cost & time:** $0 · 10–30 minutes planning

**Ready when:** You can state your daily/weekly meal volume and that it fits MEHKO limits.
searchTerms: Sierra County MEHKO daily meal limits

steps.title: Approvals & Training
steps.content:
**What to do:** Get your Certified Food Protection Manager (CFPM) credential and any required property approvals.

**Why it matters:** Food safety certification is required and property rules may apply.

**What you need:**
- ☐ CFPM certificate (ANSI-CFP recognized)
- ☐ Landlord/HOA OK if applicable
- ☐ City business license if required

**Where/how:** Take an ANSI-approved CFPM course; check local business license rules.

**Cost & time:** ~$60–$90 · 1–2 days

**Ready when:** You have a CFPM certificate and property/business approvals.

steps.title: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
steps.content:
**What to do:** Fill the SOP form covering menu, prep, storage, and sanitation.

**Why it matters:** This shows the county how you will keep food safe at home.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Menu and ingredients list
- ☐ Prep/cooking/cooling/holding details
- ☐ Cleaning/sanitizing plan

**Where/how:** Complete the SOP form when released.

**Cost & time:** $0 · 30–60 minutes

**Ready when:** SOP is complete and matches your operation.

steps.title: Health Permit Application
steps.content:
**What to do:** Complete the Health Permit Application once available.

**Why it matters:** This is the official request to operate a MEHKO.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Owner contact and address
- ☐ CFPM certificate details
- ☐ SOP — go to Step 3: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)

**Where/how:** Submit the form to Sierra County Environmental Health once published.

**Cost & time:** TBD (per fee schedule) · 15–30 minutes to fill

**Ready when:** Application is complete and consistent with your SOP.

steps.title: Submit Application & Fees
steps.content:
**What to do:** Submit your completed forms and pay the required fees.

**Why it matters:** The county processes your permit only after submission and payment.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Completed Permit Application — go to Step 4: Health Permit Application
- ☐ Completed SOP — go to Step 3: Standard Operating Procedures (SOP)
- ☐ CFPM certificate
- ☐ Payment method

**Where/how:** Submit to Sierra County Environmental Health Department in Downieville or Loyalton (details pending publication).

**Cost & time:** Fees to be set by county · 10–20 minutes to submit

**Ready when:** County confirms receipt and payment.
searchTerms: Sierra County Environmental Health permit payment

steps.title: Schedule & Pass Inspection
steps.content:
**What to do:** Schedule and pass an in-home kitchen inspection.

**Why it matters:** Inspection is required before operating.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Kitchen ready per your SOP
- ☐ Thermometer, sanitizer, handwash setup
- ☐ Equipment functional

**Where/how:** Sierra County Environmental Health will contact you to arrange inspection.

**Cost & time:** Included in permit fee · 1–2 hours on site

**Ready when:** You pass inspection and resolve corrections.
searchTerms: Sierra County Environmental Health inspection MEHKO

steps.title: Receive Permit
steps.content:
**What to do:** Obtain your MEHKO permit after passing inspection.

**Why it matters:** You must have a valid permit to operate.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Final approval notice
- ☐ Permit document

**Where/how:** Issued by Sierra County Environmental Health after approval.

**Cost & time:** $0 (after fees) · timeline depends on county

**Ready when:** You have the permit document in hand.
searchTerms: Sierra County Environmental Health MEHKO permit

steps.title: Operate & Stay Compliant
steps.content:
**What to do:** Follow your SOP and county limits; renew as required.

**Why it matters:** Compliance protects your customers and your permit.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Daily/weekly meal logs under limits
- ☐ Temperature & cleaning records
- ☐ Renewal reminders

**Where/how:** Maintain logs; contact Sierra County if your operation changes.

**Cost & time:** Renewal fees TBD · ongoing

**Ready when:** Records are maintained and renewal is on time.

steps.title: Contact Info
steps.content:
**What to do:** Use the contact information below for help.

**Why it matters:** County staff can help with specific application or inspection questions.

**What you need:**
- ☐ Phone number
- ☐ Office location
- ☐ Website

**Where/how:** Sierra County Environmental Health Department, 855-257-6136 (main line). Offices in Downieville and Loyalton.

**Cost & time:** $0 · varies

**Ready when:** You have the information you need to proceed.
